headline: DeepSeek's AI gains traction in developing nations, Microsoft report says
summary: DeepSeek, the Chinese tech startup that rivals OpenAI's ChatGPT, has been gaining ground in many developing nations in a trend that could narrow the gap of artificial intelligence adoption with advanced economies, a new report suggested.  In the Thursday report, researchers from Microsoft said global adoption of generative AI tools reached 16.3% of the world’s population in the three months to December, up from 15.1% in the previous three months.  “We are seeing a divide and we are concerned that that divide will continue to widen,” said Juan Lavista Ferres, chief data scientist for Microsoft's AI for Good Lab, which used anonymized “telemetry” to help track global device usage.

raw.headline: DeepSeek's AI gains traction in developing nations, Microsoft report says
raw.summary: DeepSeek, the Chinese tech startup that rivals OpenAI's ChatGPT, has been gaining ground in many developing nations in a trend that could narrow the gap of artificial intelligence adoption with advanced economies, a new report suggested.  In the Thursday report, researchers from Microsoft said global adoption of generative AI tools reached 16.3% of the world’s population in the three months to December, up from 15.1% in the previous three months.  “We are seeing a divide and we are concerned that that divide will continue to widen,” said Juan Lavista Ferres, chief data scientist for Microsoft's AI for Good Lab, which used anonymized “telemetry” to help track global device usage.

headline: Gemba Ignites "Fintech-in-a-Box" Revolution: Launches on Microsoft & Google Marketplaces to Let Any Tech Company Become a Bank in Minutes

headline: EU antitrust regulators to decide on Google's Wiz deal by February 10
summary: EU antitrust regulators will decide by ​February 10 whether to clear ‌Alphabet's $32 billion acquisition of cybersecurity company Wiz, ‌its largest deal ever, according to a filing on the European Commission website.  Alphabet announced the deal ⁠in March ‌last year as it doubles down on cybersecurity to ‍sharpen its edge in the cloud-computing race against Amazon.com and Microsoft.  The Commission, which acts as the EU competition enforcer, can ⁠either clear the ​deal with or ​without demanding concessions during its preliminary review, or it can ‍open a ⁠full-scale investigation if it has serious concerns.

raw.headline: EU antitrust regulators to decide on Google's Wiz deal by February 10
raw.summary: EU antitrust regulators will decide by ​February 10 whether to clear ‌Alphabet's $32 billion acquisition of cybersecurity company Wiz, ‌its largest deal ever, according to a filing on the European Commission website.  Alphabet announced the deal ⁠in March ‌last year as it doubles down on cybersecurity to ‍sharpen its edge in the cloud-computing race against Amazon.com and Microsoft.  The Commission, which acts as the EU competition enforcer, can ⁠either clear the ​deal with or ​without demanding concessions during its preliminary review, or it can ‍open a ⁠full-scale investigation if it has serious concerns.

headline: Best Stock Trade of 2025 Keeps Running, Question Is for How Long
summary: Memory and storage companies were the leading performers in the S&P 500 Index last year, as the massive amounts of cash being spent on building out AI infrastructure trickled down to some traditionally staid parts of the tech sector.  Sandisk popped 16% on the first trading day of the year and then soared 28% on Tuesday after Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang highlighted the need for more memory and storage in the AI ecosystem.
